Misconfigurations.Title: ':latest' tag used
Misconfigurations.Description: When using a 'FROM' statement you should use a specific tag to avoid uncontrolled behavior when the image is updated.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify a tag in the 'FROM' statement for image 'gcr.io/distroless/nodejs20-debian12'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a tag to the image in the 'FROM' statement

Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN cd ...' to change directory
Misconfigurations.Description: Use WORKDIR instead of proliferating instructions like 'RUN cd â€¦ && do-something', which are hard to read, troubleshoot, and maintain.
Misconfigurations.Message: RUN should not be used to change directory: 'rm -rf node_modules/libxmljs/build &&   cd node_modules/libxmljs &&   npm run build'. Use 'WORKDIR' statement instead.

Misconfigurations.Title: No HEALTHCHECK defined
Misconfigurations.Description: You should add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your docker container images to perform the health check on running containers.
Misconfigurations.Message: Add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get' missing '--no-install-recommends'
Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get' install should use '--no-install-recommends' to minimize image size.
Misconfigurations.Message: '--no-install-recommends' flag is missed: 'apt-get update && apt-get install -y build-essential python3'

Lines.Content: RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y build-essential python3
Lines.Highlighted: [38;5;64mRUN[0m apt-get update [38;5;245m&&[0m apt-get install -y build-essential python3

Misconfigurations.Title: Image user should not be 'root'
Misconfigurations.Description: Running containers with 'root' user can lead to a container escape situation. It is a best practice to run containers as non-root users, which can be done by adding a 'USER' statement to the Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify at least 1 USER command in Dockerfile with non-root user as argument
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: ADD instead of COPY
Misconfigurations.Description: You should use COPY instead of ADD unless you want to extract a tar file. Note that an ADD command will extract a tar file, which adds the risk of Zip-based vulnerabilities. Accordingly, it is advised to use a COPY command, which does not extract tar files.
Misconfigurations.Message: Consider using 'COPY . /usr/src/' command instead of 'ADD . /usr/src/'

Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN <package-manager> update' instruction alone
Misconfigurations.Description: The instruction 'RUN <package-manager> update' should always be followed by '<package-manager> install' in the same RUN statement.
Misconfigurations.Message: The instruction 'RUN <package-manager> update' should always be followed by '<package-manager> install' in the same RUN statement.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Combine '<package-manager> update' and '<package-manager> install' instructions to single one

Misconfigurations.Title: Deprecated MAINTAINER used
Misconfigurations.Description: MAINTAINER has been deprecated since Docker 1.13.0.
Misconfigurations.Message: MAINTAINER should not be used: 'MAINTAINER William Blankenship <william.jblankenship@gmail.com>'

Misconfigurations.Title: No HEALTHCHECK defined
Misconfigurations.Description: You should add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your docker container images to perform the health check on running containers.
Misconfigurations.Message: Add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get' missing '--no-install-recommends'
Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get' install should use '--no-install-recommends' to minimize image size.
Misconfigurations.Message: '--no-install-recommends' flag is missed: 'apt-get install nodejs -y --force-yes'

Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get' missing '--no-install-recommends'
Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get' install should use '--no-install-recommends' to minimize image size.
Misconfigurations.Message: '--no-install-recommends' flag is missed: 'apt-get update &&     apt-get install -y --force-yes       curl       apt-transport-https       lsb-release       build-essential       python-all'

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile
